chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Allen Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 2/2/16 - Def is eligible for Sub Abuse Program
Consecutive to: Case #15 CF 045

Notice to Def-installation of ignition interlock device, cost reduction on IID, and links to Information on DMV website.
Mandatory interlock for all alcohol concentration-License restricted to interlocked vehicles, plus all registered and titled vehicles (unless exempted) for a period of no less than one year BEGINNING when the license is issued.

Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 48 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def to enroll in the Ashland County Adult Drug Court & complete successfully.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Def granted credit for time served.
Def to report IMMEDIATELY to ACJ.
